Table of Contents

Class AppEnd

Namespace
Booseapp
Assembly
Booseapp.dll

Represents the end marker command used to close compound blocks such as if, else, for, while, and method. During compilation it links the corresponding opening command to its end line. During execution it performs any required control-flow (looping or method return).

public class AppEnd : Command, ICommand

Methods

CheckParameters(string[])

Validates parameters for the end command.

public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameter)

Parameters

parameter string[]

The parameter list passed to the command.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown when parameters are missing.

Compile()

Compiles the end command by determining which block type it is ending and linking the corresponding open command to this line number. Supports variants such as end, end if, end for, end while, and end method.

public override void Compile()

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown when no matching open block exists.

Execute()

Executes the end marker. Depending on the block type, this may:

  • Return from a method by restoring the saved program counter.
  • Advance a for loop to the next iteration and jump back if still in range.
  • Re-evaluate a while condition and jump back if it remains true.
public override void Execute()
